comms: Arguably, the NP in the genitive is a clause-level constituent.

Non-verbal predicate. Так называемый статив (см. Кибрик 75, Даниэль 2018). Это property words / states, некий отдельный класс предактивных единиц. Alternative is “wiχ de-ke-r” [be.trusting 2-become-Ipfv] with the same valency frame.
Комментарий: not separable from ɬːʷaːna.
Comment: binominative construction resolves into transitive, cf. “Пышаму хьIон абк1у“ (paša-mu χˁon a<b>kʼu) [Paša-Erg cow <3>drive.Pfv].
Comment: resultative
χir is part of the predicate (an adverbial element). The NP in the dative case can be omitted.
Alternative is “χːams haˁtər-če-qˁ-ak ebdi” [bear river-Obl.Pl-Inter-Latreach-2-Pfv] ‘The bear reached the bank’ with the pattern NOM_INTER.LAT.

Comment: у этого глагола есть еще значения тыкать, бить - то есть намеренного прикосновения; но и в ненамеренном вроде можно. И это неполная рамка - скорее всего можно добавить “чем притронулся в номинативе”.
Non-verbal predicate. Comment: separation test confirms clause level status: Cf. гьалмахкул и Пышан МыхIоммадлыллъу.
The NP in the dative case cannot be separated from the “χir” element. For this reason, the combination of the dative case and “χir” is considered as an argument encoding device here.
Presumably, the pahmu-li-n heʟʼən combination is semantically equivalent to just ‘memory’; heʟʼən functions as an empty head.

back_translation_en: ‘Паша познакомился с Магомедом год тому назад.’

comms_internal: A literal meaning is ‘Pasha remained there not being a house’.

comms: Comment: binominative construction resolves into transitive, “Пышаму гату бысо” / “Paša-mu gatu bo-so” [Paša-Obl(Erg) cat 3-touch.Pfv].
No satisfactory translation has been obtained.
Alternative is a construction with ‘want’: “ПатIиматлис мышин кьанши” / “patʼimat-li-s mašin ʟʼan-ši” [Patimat-Obl-Dat car want-Cvb.Ipfv(4.be)], with the same valency frame.

This is a transimpersonal construction. It is not clear whether the NP in the nominative case shares syntactic properties with another nominative NPs, but this is hard to check given that this verb lack agreement markers anyway. Cf. also “Йамут гьекьыммыттик вар компас бона” / “jamu-t heʟʼəm-mə-tː-ik war kompas bo-na” [this-4 thing-Obl-Sup-Lat say.Ipfv compass say.Pfv-Cvb].

The NP in the dative case cannot be separated from the “χir” element. For this reason, the combination of the dative case and “χir” is considered as an argument encoding device here.
The NP in the dative case can be separated from the “χir” element. Here, the χir element is considered as part of the predicate.

comms: Alternative is a symmetrical construction: “Пышану Мыриннину дандыкквий этти” / “paša-n=u marin-ni-n=u dandəkːʷij etːi” [Paša-Gen=Add Marin-Obl-Gen=Add agreement 4.become.Pfv], which rather means “пришел к согласию”, “договорился после расхождений”. Cf. also “С кем Паша согласился? С Мариной”: Пыша ллъаллъу ры?зи ивтти? Мариналлъу

comms: Separation and interrogative susbstitution tests confirms clause level dependence: ‘Паша что потерял?’: накIын итIетти Пышан; ‘Что Паша потерял?’: Пышан гьан ит1еттыли
It is not entirely clear whether the first NP conventionally denotes a wooden log.
Comment: third argument is (often) omitted.
The NP in the genitive displays some properties of a clause-level constituent. В частности, можно и разрыв, и замена на вопросительное слово: Пышаму къимат бар Мыриннин. Пышаму ллъан къимат бар?
